diseaseDescription: A fast-spreading bacterial disease caused by Erwinia and Pectobacterium, leading to mushy, foul-smelling leaves, stems, and pseudobulbs, especially in hot and wet conditions.

culturalCare.title: Control Humidity
steps: Keep humidity between 50–60%
Use fans or open windows for airflow
Avoid overwatering to reduce excess moisture

culturalCare.title: Watering
steps: Water in the morning so plants dry before night
Apply water at the base, not over leaves
Ensure potting media drains well

culturalCare.title: Remove Infected Tissue
steps: Cut off mushy or rotting parts with sterile tools
Burn or bag infected tissue immediately
Disinfect cutting tools after each use

chemicalControl.title: Copper-based Bactericides
steps: Use copper hydroxide 2–3 g/L
Spray all plant surfaces weekly
Avoid overuse to prevent plant damage

chemicalControl.title: Quaternary Ammonium (Physan 20)
steps: Mix 1 tsp/L solution
Mist all plant surfaces and potting media
Repeat as directed on label

chemicalControl.title: Hydrogen Peroxide
steps: Apply 3% solution directly to infected areas
Repeat treatment as needed
Monitor plants for reinfection

ecoFriendly.title: Cinnamon Powder
steps: Dust on fresh cut surfaces after trimming
Acts as a natural antifungal and antibacterial

ecoFriendly.title: Neem Oil
steps: Use 2–3 ml/L weekly
Spray all plant surfaces, including undersides
Avoid spraying in peak heat
